file_content.text: My lord, I am docked at the space station above Hoth.
Very good. Now that Admiral Monk and the War Trust have fallen to your might, all that remains is Jedi Knight Xerender.
Xerender has dedicated himself to the Republic like no other, he's led our enemies to many cunning victories.
Not only is he a symbol of inspiration for the Republic, he's been a thorn in my side for a long time.
I will bury him in the snow.
He won't leave alive.
Do you know what he's trying to achieve here?
Why is he on Hoth?
Is he a legitimate target for Plan Zero, or is this just a vendetta?
So this is personal.
Why can't it be both? The satisfaction will be compounded when he is no more.
The Chiss traitor you spared confirmed Xerender's presence and has since informed me that the Jedi is seeking a secret superweapon.
Intelligence reports suggest that he has brought his troop of elite special ops to seek a secret superweapon.
I can uncover no information about this weapon, only that it was lost in the wreckage of one of the crashed star ships from the war.
Once I stop Xerender, whatever he's after will be inconsequential.
The weapon doesn't matter.
Xerender isn't one to waste time on anything less than a critical mission. His death is the primary goal, but I want to know what he seeks.
Maybe we can use the Republic's toy against them.
Should I get the weapon?
Perhaps. If Xerender wants it, it must be very powerful. His death is the goal, but if the weapon can be salvaged, all the better.
That's very little to go on.
Not much help.
Xerender is a shrewd target--we're fortunate to have this much insight. Killing him is paramount--if you discover the superweapon, all the better.
Your contact on the surface is Commander Lanklyn. He's been tracking Xerender and should be ready to meet you at the Imperial Base.
The commander occasionally bites off more than he can chew. But he's been warned that this mission cannot afford anything less than perfection.
Xerender is the last of your targets. Report to me when you know the nature of the superweapon he seeks. Get this right, apprentice.
Hoth. Back in the day, I managed to escape assignment here. It chills my bones just to be in orbit above this frigid planet.
Uhm, yeah, you should (cough) leave me on the ship. I'm (cough)... I think I'm fighting off a cold (cough-cough).
Forget those cowards, my lord. A little snow won't stop me. I'm ready for action.
I too would gladly accompany you on this mission, my lord. I wish to see all the galaxy has to offer.
The soldier mirrors my attitude, master. I want to consume every experience I can.
I will continue to search for Admiral Monk. Report back when you have learned the nature of the superweapon Xerender seeks.
And why is that? I specifically directed you to stop the siege of Darth Vengean's flagship and kill Admiral Monk.
Monk has come out of his hole. This will be our only opportunity to destroy him.
Head to the conflict in space immediately!
Very good. My efforts to locate Admiral Monk, the missing Republic leader, are ongoing. Your target on this planet is Jedi Knight Xerender.
My lord, I wish to see all the galaxy has to offer. I will happily join you on Hoth.
Cold won't stop me. Let them sit on their hands here on the ship. I'm hungry for any experience I can get.
